Milt,
You have a high tolerance for mystery if that counts as a solution.  (Translation reads:  no idea.)  

No doubt that they're the same model, though.  Also, while they only have a kogai ana, both were made to mount with a kozuka.

Jim 



  gang,
  a while back I asked about the school of my rat tsuba I purchased on 
  e-bay..........

  klick............

  http://tinyurl.com/sm1g

  I found an identical design one in Haynes catalog # 6 , lot 32
  I quote  .......... " the fact that it has only kogai hitsu indicates 
  this was mounted on a fine tanto. Probably made in Kyoto, but the 
  whole feeling and style are not to be associated with any school, but 
  show indications of several schools. The Akasaka, Kyo-sukashi, even 
  Higo and independent unknown masters. Ca. 1600  "


  thanks, -t, for the catalogs !!

  -M
